title.narrative: Nigeria COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Project

activity-date.narrative: Planned start date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity
Actual end date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2021
Total Commitment in Third Quarter of 2020

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall: (a) by no later than one (1) month after the Effectiveness Date, prepare and adopt a Project implementationmanual (PIM) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for the implementation of the Project in form and substance satisfactoryto the Association; and (b) except as the Bank shall otherwise agree in writing; not amend or waive or permit to be amended orwaived any provision of the PIM.

The Recipient shall, no later than one (1) month after the Effectiveness Date, establish and thereafter maintain throughout theProject implementation a National Steering Committee at federal level (NSC) with functions, composition and resources satisfactoryto the Association.

The Recipient shall, no later than one (1) month after the Effectiveness Date, establish and thereafter maintain throughout theProject implementation a National Technical Committee at federal level (NTC) with functions, composition and resources satisfactoryto the Association.

The Recipient shall engage, no later than sixty (60) days after the Effectiveness Date, technical staff for the ProjectCoordinating Unit (PCU), in such numbers and with such qualifications and terms of reference as may be acceptable to theAssociation, to enable the PCU to oversee the implementation of both the Project and REDISSE II.

The Recipient shall furnish to the Association, as soon as available, but in any case not later than November 30 of each year, theconsolidated annual work plan and budget for their review and approval; except for the annual work plan and budget for the Projectfor the first year of Project implementation, which shall be furnished no later than one month after the Effectiveness Date.

title.narrative: Percentage of contacts of confirmed cases reached and followed up
Percentage of testing labs with at least 90% of samples with turn-around-time of 48 hours between sample collection and delivery ofresult
Number of states that have an established EOC and activated IMS for COVID-19
Number of states with at least three functional Isolation/ treatment/ community support centres with holding area for the management of COVID -19 patients
Number of states with at least one state-owned laboratory with capacity to perform diagnosis of COVID-19 according to national guidelines
Number of diagnosed cases treated at the designated isolation or treatment center per national protocols
Number of health workers trained in infection prevention and control per national protocols
Number of states with platforms for reporting SEA and gender related complaints according to guiding national protocol.
Number of states having adopted health strategy adopting measures to address climate risks
Number of states reporting both treatment and laboratory data using SORMAS
Number of states with M&E system developed and is being implemented to monitor COVID-19 preparedness and response plan.
Number of states with functional transfer systems for COVID-19 patients
Number of states reporting designated isolation /treatment facilities reported supervisory visit in the previous quarter
Number of states with at least fifty health centers with triage capacity
Number of states adopting IEC /BCC guidelines according to national protocol for COVID-19 response.
Number of states reporting designated isolation/treatment facilities with no stock out of basic IPC and WASH commodities in the previous quarter
